Falcon Pointe 
HOA
Wooden Fence 
Replacement Overview



Contents

• Service Offering Summary
• Fence Improvements

Service Offering Inclusion Summary
✓ Confirm resident notification with fence replacement date range
✓ Old fence teardown
✓ Old fence materials haul off
✓ Remove minor vegetation and minor landscaping fence line obstructions
✓ Reset/level plumb metal posts in concrete
✓ Temporary install privacy screen fabric while concrete sets, approximately 

one to four days, weather permitting (fabric NOT designed for pet 
containment)

✓ Install 100% cedar fence, pre-stained wood with oil base stain
✓ Assembled with exterior coated screws (allows for easy repair/disassembly)
✓ Clean up area, includes pressure washing concrete as needed
✓ 10-year workmanship warranty 
✓ 3-year stain warranty (does NOT cover sprinkler water marks)



Fence Improvements
Category Existing Fence New Fence
Repels Water/Ice Only one side of fence ~40% 100% of fence

Fasteners Ring Shank Nails (Ruins wood for repair) Screws (Easy repair)

Staining Application One side – only street side All 6 sides of each board

Staining Application Top cap board NOT stained Top board stained

Staining Application Resident responsible for inside N/A – Non-issue

Staining Application Over spray protection required (cars, pools, house, 
residential/HOA landscaping, backyard items, etc.)

N/A – Done offsite

coordination/scheduling required

N/A – Done offsite

Staining Price Includes material and labor cost for One side 
application (Excludes Top Cap)

Includes material cost for ALL sides

documents.content:
Paints 
(Volume discount)

Wood Type Sizes: 
2x8,2X6,2x4,1X6X6

Same (Cedar) Same (Cedar)



Operational Process

Notify

•Coordinate scheduling notifications to residents of HOA fence replacement
•Encourage residents to replace their adjacent HOA type fence at the same time; Provide quotes upon request

(Residential fence installation at a later date will likely cost more)

Teardown

•Dismantle old fence
•Haul off old fence material
•Clear fence line of vegetation obstruction

Build

•Reset/level plumb posts in concrete 
•Set up privacy screen (while concrete dries)
• Install wood fence material

Clean Up

•Pick up wood scraps
•Rinse off area and pressure wash as needed



Fence and Stain Warranty

• 10-Year Warranty on the fence workmanship
• 3-Year Warranty on the fence stain, however, excludes areas with 

sprinkler water marks and damage cause intentional defacing
• Contact us at https://romanspwfs.com/ to file a claim

https://romanspwfs.com/


Residential Fence Replacement

• Follows the same process of the HOA fence replacement
• Billed directly to the resident (50% due before 

teardown/installation)
• Will not delay HOA timeline
• Will likely cost more if done at a later date



Thank you!

Page 1 of 2

ASPC - Falcon Point (Goodwin & Company)
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Dear Gino Cebollero,

We are pleased to provide you with a proposal to complete the exterior service repairs at your community located at 19015 Falcon
Pointe Blvd Pflugerville, TX 78660.
 
We appreciate the opportunity to provide this proposal to you and hope to earn your business. Don't hesitate to get in touch with me
with any questions.
 
Henry Cuadros
Branch Manager of Texas
(262) 629-7151

Scope of Work: Fence Audit Report
 

Crew member(s) will have on a high visibility logoed shirts to easily identified1.
Site audit report with pictures, location & a scope provided to client/management for repairs2.
Issues identified will be documented in the order they should be addressed/repaired3.

Note
This includes inspecting all areas identified in map provided by client/manager1.
Day(s) to complete inspection & report 3weeks -15 days weather permitting2.

Total: $3200.00



Page 2 of 2

ASPC - Falcon Point (Goodwin & Company)
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Assumptions, Clarifications and Exclusions:
This proposal may be withdrawn by Aspen Group if not accepted within 30 days.1.
Pricing assumes unfettered access to the property during the project.2.
If Aspen Group encounters unforeseen conditions that differ from those anticipated or ordinarily found to3.
exist in the construction activities being provided, Aspen Group retains the right to make an equitable
adjustment to the pricing.
Client will provide electrical power and water at no charge.4.
Client will provide a location for dumpster on site for trash and material disposal.5.
Mold/Asbestos/Lead Paint: Any detection or remediation of mold, asbestos, and lead paint is specifically6.
excluded from this proposal. Any costs associated with the detection and/or removal of mold, mold spores,
asbestos, and lead paint is the responsibility of others.

Scope of Work
We would like to thank you for giving us the opportunity to earn your business. We've
included a detailed estimate of your project along with as many details as possilble

If you have any questions about our bid, material, service, pricing or any other question,
please don't hesitate to call. We have many price points that fits most budgets. 

We've been building all types of fences since 2006. We build residential & commercial, wood
privacy of just about any style, ornamental iron, chainlink, custom gates, gate operators
installation, decks & pergolas. We always use screws as fasteners not nails. We use premium
quality wood on all wood projects, superior quality ornamental iron (wrought iron) & buy from
the national suppliers for consistency and lower prices. Not the big box stores, actual fence
suppliers.

We build over 25 miles of fence a year and our combined years of fence experience is near
150 years. We are the Premier fence company of Central Texas if you want it built right and to

documents.content:
Goodwin & Company (Exterior)
ASPC - Falcon Point
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Dear Gino Cebollero,

We are pleased to provide you with a proposal to complete the exterior service repairs at your community located at 19015 Falcon
Pointe Blvd  Pflugerville, TX 78660.
 
Our team provides top-tier solutions, from painting and power washing to full exterior transformations, all crafted to enhance the beauty and
durability of your property. With our expertise and dedication to excellence, we are confident that our services will not only meet but surpass your
expectations. We look forward to bringing your vision to life.
Please feel free to contact us with any questions or if you need further information

 
Henry Cuadros
Branch Manager of Texas
(262) 629-7151

Scope of Work:

This proposal covers the cost of labor and materials needed for the requested fence repairs located at 19015 Falcon Pointe
Blvd. covering fence lines 4, 5, 8, 24, 25, 26, 28, 29, 47, 51, 55, and 56 that where identified to be the most needed repairs

•

While on-site, workers will be wearing fluorescent green, high-viz shirts as well as any other PPE necessary to safely complete
the repairs.

•

Work area will be secured with caution tape and cones.•
Before work begins sufficient notice must be sent out to residents•
Work will begin on fenceline 4 and work up•
 Approximately (92) 1”x6’ cedar pickets; (8) 2”x6” cedar top plates; (18) 2”x4” cedar bottom plates will be replaced and (7) 2”x4”
cedar bottom rails will be re-secured.

•

 All connectors will be corrosive-resistant, galvanized screws/nails.•
All wood will be cedar to match the existing and receive a stain to match the color•
Stain will be certified Sherwin William and will receive a standard two-coat process 3 if necessary•
 Work areas will be thoroughly cleaned.•
 All trash and debris will be disposed of legally.•

Total: $14,363.10



Goodwin & Company (Exterior)
ASPC - Falcon Point
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd

April 2024 ManApril 2024 Man ​agement Reportagement Report
Falcon Pointe Community AssociationFalcon Pointe Community Association

April 26, 2024
 
Falcon Pointe Community, Inc.
Board of Directors
19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd.        
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Dear Board Members,
 
Below you will find a summary of operations, administrative,
fiscal/accounting, maintenance, community standards, lifestyle,
and other operational items for March 2024. Please let me know
if you have any questions.

General Operations/AdministrativeGeneral Operations/Administrative

Updated PAL (priority action list) from the March 19 th meeting on Trello.
Working with the office staff at Longoria Masonry to determine which residents' rock walls are
being worked on to get notices out.
Installed the 30.05 gun sign at the amenity center.
Reached out to Vendors for proposals on wood fencing, wood staining, elkay drinking fountain
repair, electrical, and Shade Structures.
Working with the Landscape Committee to provide them with parkland agreement information
and erosion area information.
Tested sending the Quarterly Newsletter through Constant Contact vs. TownSQ and Goodwin
Notices.
Made a workable spreadsheet for resident wood fence repair requests. This way, we can
determine which sections of fencing we need to start repairs on first. Currently seeking vendors
for this project.
Tarryn submitted her resignation on April 10th, with her last day being April 22nd. She accepted a
management role at the Stone Hill Apartments across the street, and we wish her the best of
luck!
Justin Hale has accepted the ACAM/Lifestyle Coordinator position for Falcon Pointe and will

begin his 90-day onboarding and orientation on Monday, April 29th.

View the April Management SummaryView the April Management Summary
HereHere

Fiscal/AccountingFiscal/Accounting

March 31, 2024- Operating cash $390k, Reserve cash $886k.
Net income/gain in March 2024 was $168,946.94.

Proper prep. Masking to protect property. Powerwash and acid wash the existing texture. Install two coats of Suncoat clear 
sealer with Shark Grip. Clean up when work is complete. Clear sealer - $8,932.00
Note: There will be a one-year warranty on the clear sealer guaranteeing our clear sealer will bond to the existing texture. If 
the existing texture disbonds from the previous company, this does not fall under one-year warranty service for the sealer. It 
is our recommendation to clear seal the current texture which will add an additional wear layer and reflect UV rays. UV rays 
bake the texture causing it to become brittle and disbond. Clear sealers also are more resistant to chemicals, staining, and 
easier to clean. To help protect your initial investment - Recommendations prior to clear:
Crack treatment - $200.00           Misc. Repairs:  Spot texture, spot color, extra masking  - $600.00

Falcon Pointe Homeowners Association, Inc. 

COVID-19 Temporary Pool Protocols and Rules 

 

COVID-19 Warning: The danger of exposure to the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 still exists. The 

Association cannot ensure that any surface is germ-free. By entering the Falcon Pointe Community pool, 

courts and park areas, you take responsibility for your own protection, including for disinfecting your hands 

and any surface you touch.   

Gate Guards reserve the right to close the pool at any time. Usage is by reservation only. 

Current Capacity Limits: 50% (68 people) 

Lap Pool Hours 5am-7am, and 7:30pm-10:00pm 

Recreational Pool Hours 11am to 7pm 

✓ Face masks are required over age of 6 during check-in, check-out and while using bathrooms. 

✓ The pool gate will remain locked and the Gate Monitor will provide access. Residents must swipe an 

active pool badge. Once admitted electronically, residents are required to check in/out with the Gate 

Monitor who will log the arrival and departure date/times, verify reservation, number in group, and obtain 

a signed waiver from each adult. The hard copy, signed waiver, will be filed under your address. 

✓ Residents must wait outside the gate until other residents leave from their block of time. If the pool is 

experiencing high demand, residents may be limited to three or less visits per week. 

✓ All households will be required to have a signed liability waiver on file (listing all accompanying minor 

children, if any). NO GUESTS ALLOWED, AT THIS TIME. To save time at check-in and reduce contact risk, 

please download the waiver from the townsq.io website to print and sign at home and bring with you. 

You’ll need your HOA account number to register for townsq.io. This can be found on your HOA statement. 

You can contact Customer Service for assistance, if you do not know your account number, contact 

info@goodwintx.com, or 512.502.7515 (please leave a detailed message including your address and

documents.content:
December 1, 2014 
  
 
Falcon Pointe Community Association, Inc. (HOA) would like to extend an opportunity to your 
company to bid on the landscape maintenance services for the Falcon Pointe Community Association 
in Pflugerville, Texas. 
 
Attached you will find a color coded landscape map, which indicates the general areas to be 
maintained by the HOA and should be used as the basis for the landscape bid along with the 
specifications below.  Areas in dark green represent those areas to be maintained by the HOA.  The 
hand-drawn areas in dark green are also areas to be maintained the by HOA. 
 
General Specifications of Service*: 
 

 Mowing, edging, and trimming of all turf (44 visits per year). 
 Normal trash and debris pickup and removal from serviced areas during each visit (44 visits 

per year). 
 Beds and tree rings maintained free of weeds (44 visits per year). 

 Turf and Ornamental fertilization application (Turf: 4 times per year, Ornamental: 2 times per 
year). Spot treatment to be performed as needed. 

 Turf and Ornamental pre-emergent herbicide application (2 times per year).  Spot treatment to 
be performed as needed. 

 Spreading of fire ant bait over entire property (2 times per year). Spot treatment to be 
performed as needed. 

 Perennials & Native Grasses cut back once per year during winter months. 
 Trees to be pruned and sucker growth removed as needed to promote a natural & healthy 

form. 
 Irrigation system monitored each visit and a full system check and adjustment performed 

monthly.  A copy of the full system check report is to be provided to the Falcon Pointe on-site 
manager. 

 Hardwood Mulch application to beds & tree rings (2 times per year). 
 Seasonal flower rotations (5 times per year). 

 
The area outlined in red represents a nature trail that requires a monthly mow strip along the fence 
line and an annual comprehensive mow of grass on both sides of the trail.

December 1, 2014
	

Falcon Pointe Community Association, Inc. (HOA) would like to extend an opportunity to your company to bid on the landscape maintenance services for the Falcon Pointe Community Association in Pflugerville, Texas.

Attached you will find a color coded landscape map, which indicates the general areas to be maintained by the HOA and should be used as the basis for the landscape bid along with the specifications below.  Areas in dark green represent those areas to be maintained by the HOA.  The hand-drawn areas in dark green are also areas to be maintained the by HOA.

General Specifications of Service*:

· Mowing, edging, and trimming of all turf (44 visits per year).
· Normal trash and debris pickup and removal from serviced areas during each visit (44 visits per year).
· Beds and tree rings maintained free of weeds (44 visits per year).
· Turf and Ornamental fertilization application (Turf: 4 times per year, Ornamental: 2 times per year). Spot treatment to be performed as needed.
· Turf and Ornamental pre-emergent herbicide application (2 times per year).  Spot treatment to be performed as needed.
· Spreading of fire ant bait over entire property (2 times per year). Spot treatment to be performed as needed.
· Perennials & Native Grasses cut back once per year during winter months.
· Trees to be pruned and sucker growth removed as needed to promote a natural & healthy form.
· Irrigation system monitored each visit and a full system check and adjustment performed monthly.  A copy of the full system check report is to be provided to the Falcon Pointe on-site manager.
· Hardwood Mulch application to beds & tree rings (2 times per year).
· Seasonal flower rotations (5 times per year).

The area outlined in red represents a nature trail that requires a monthly mow strip along the fence line and an annual comprehensive mow of grass on both sides of the trail.

 Vacuum carpeting and walk on rugs.

FALCON POINTE FLYERS PROPOSAL 
 
Structure: 501(c)3 
 Operates independently of Falcon Pointe HOA 
 Carries separate insurance 
 Manages separate budget (membership & sponsorship driven) 
 
Team Membership 
 Open to residents of Falcon Pointe neighborhood, aged 4-18 
 
League 
 North Austin Aquatic League  
 
Teams 

1. Avery Ranch Redfish 
2. Great Hills Gators 
3. Pflugerville Fast Frogs 
4. Balcones Blue Waves 
5. Austin JCC 
6. Twin Creeks Twisters 
7. Westover Orcas 
8. Falcon Pointe Flyers 

 
Coaching Stagg 
 Proposed Head Coach 

Jessica Jones – former high school swimmer; current teacher in PFISD 
 Assistant Coaches: TBD 
 
Schedule (2019)  
 *No “home” meets at Falcon Pointe pool in year 1 
 March 1 – Registration 
 March-April – League training, volunteer training, preparation 

May 1 – Practice Begins – after school (4:00pm-7:00pm) 
 May 25 – Meet 
 June 1 – Meet 
  Continued next page > 



FALCON POINTE FLYERS PROPOSAL 
	

Page 2 of 4	

 < continued from previous page 

June 3 – Practice moves to mornings (8:00am-11:00am) 
 June 8 – Meet 
 June 15 – Meet 
 June 22 – Meet 
 June 29 – Meet 
 July 4 – Parade & Neighborhood Party 
 July 6 – Championships 
 July 8 – End of Season banquet 
 
Pool Usage 

AFTERNOON SCHEDULE 
May 1st – May 29th, Monday – Thursday: 3:30pm – 7:30pm 
No practice on Memorial Day, May 27th and May 30th ( last day of 
PFISD school).  

MORNING SCHEDULE 

June 3rd – July 5, Monday – Friday: 7:30am – 11:30 
No practice on July 4th 

 
Request of HOA 

1) Pool usage during the requested times 
2) Purchase of lane ropes and spool for team usage 
3) Support of team’s presence in neighborhood  

 
 
Previous Objections 

1. Facility Size 
a. Falcon Pointe facility: ~22,000 sqft 
b. Average other facility size: ~20,900 sqft (inside pool fence, no bldgs.) 
c. Largest other facility in league: ~43,000 sqft (Avery Ranch) 
d. Smallest other facility in league: ~8,000 sqft (Lakewood pool) 

2. Noise

LANDSCAPE MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT

THIS AGREEMENT is entered into September 21, 2020, by and between LandCare USA, LLC, located at 5151 
Shoreham Pl. Suite 140, San Diego, CA 92122, hereafter referred to as the "Contractor", and Goodwin 
Management Co., the Owner or designated Owner's Representative, hereinafter referred to as “Owner”.

The parties wish to enter into an agreement to define the terms and conditions under which Contractor will 
provide landscape maintenance services to Owner.

The parties hereby agree as follows:

1) Services.  The Contractor agrees to perform the landscape management services noted on the
"Landscape Management Annual Schedule" in accordance with the “Specifications” both of which are
documents.path: /drives/b!nslWL7oJf0GurAFazjx4oOabfa0q4iZMh47wxSLJiqST3qiwOUFDQ6RKwkvmcuX4/root:/Falcon Pointe/Operations/Vendors/Landscape/2020-2021 landcare contract current/Falcon Pointe Landscape Maintenance Renewal - signed.pdf

documents.content:
purposes. 

2.1.120. For any applications of fertilizer and/or pesticides and herbicides, the contractor or 
subcontractor must have and maintain a pest control or herbicide applicator license. 

2.1.121. Once product submittals have been submitted and approved by Falcon Pointe HOA and 
the contractor commences work, the contractor must not 

2.1.122. change the approved products at any time during the term of this contract without prior 
written approval from Falcon Pointe HOA. 

 

2.1.123. CONTRACTOR STAFF REQUIREMENTS 
2.1.124. Contractor shall provide a dedicated individual and back-up to serve as the Landscape 

Supervisor who shall be present on site during each service visit.  This individual shall 
serve as the lead point of contact for issues and all contract related operations to Falcon 
Pointe HOA. This individual and their back-up must be identified immediately upon contract 
award. 

2.1.125. The contractor’s staff shall, at a minimum, wear a company shirt provided by the contractor. 
2.1.126. Within 10 calendar days of contract award date the contractor shall identify its team members 

who will be performing services under this contract. 
 

2.1.127. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS 
2.1.128. The contractor shall inspect all grass areas, plants and trees for signs of disease, infestation, 

yellowing of leaves or insect-ridden conditions each service and treat as needed. The results 
of these inspections and treatments will be reported to Falcon Pointe HOA during each visit and 
recorded on a Monthly Work Report, as described in the following section. 

 

2.1.129. MONTHLY WORK REPORT 
2.1.130. A Monthly Work Report will be used by the contractor as a means to verify the performance 

of services in order to establish a proportional deduction in payment, if services are not 
performed as required by the contract. 

2.1.131. Although the contract price was bid as a yearly contract amount, it is the express intent of

documents.content:
Falcon Pointe HOA

Landscape Maintenance 

Water Management 

Enhancement Solutions 

Partnering with you: 

Alec Ryan | Branch Manager 
Alec.Ryan@Landcare.com  
512-718-9609



Alec Ryan 

C. 512-718-9609

O. 512-458-9973

Austin 

2100 Polaris Ave. 

Austin, TX 78757 

www.landcare.com 

Thank you for the opportunity to provide a landscape maintenance proposal for Falcon Pointe HOA.

After reviewing the properties current status and everything that goes in to the community, we

believe we can continue to provide quality landscape service and improve your overall landscape

experience. LandCare takes pride in being a trusted advisor for you and your team.

After speaking with you, Monique, and the Landscape Comittee, we know LandCare will address any

current concerns you have while exceeding expectations. We will do this by: 

• Offer a full credit of the tree trimming proposal over three years (33K value/year) for the 
property upon execution of a three year renewal of the maintenance contract. Tree trimming 
is a great multiple year plan and to combine this with the maintenance contract at no charge 
will bring great value to the property.

• Our irrigation inspections identify the efficiency of your system and allow us to propose 
improvements that will help you lower your operating costs, while protecting plants, site 
operations, and infrastructure. More involved analysis with return on investment calculations is 
also available which will incorporate any available rebates or incentives from your local water 
authority.

• Providing an account manager to the property for proactive communication and immediate 
follow up. Our qualified account managers are dedicated to properties to serve them and 
create a true partnership. This results in less oversight and frustration creating a true trusted 
advisor for the property.

• While communication and responsiveness are one of our highest priorities, we also know that 
quality work is of high importance as well.

Goodwin Management, Inc

11149 Research Boulevard

Chris Roberts

falconpointemaintenance@goodwintx.com

Quote created by: Shane Bauerle

CEO

shane@bpi-civil.com

Comments from Shane

Hello Chris,

Thank you for the opportunity to provide Goodwin Management with two options for the Water Quality Pond

located at FM 685 & SH 130 (Falcon Pointe Subdivision).

~Cliff Notes~

Option A – Includes Loading & Hauling the existing stockpile offsite.

Option B – Includes embanking / grading the existing stockpile onsite and comes with savings, as you will see.

Products & Services



Item & Description Quantity Unit Price Total

Water Quality Pond - Sediment Removal & Maintenance Package A 1 $263,332.91  $263,332.91
Option: 1A

Mobilization.

Sediment Removal at Pond Inflow. 

Grade Southern Slope adjacent to Concrete Flume.

Embank Eroded Area(s) along the Southern portion of the Concrete Trickle Channel.

Sediment Removal at Concrete Box Culvert and Descending Channel.

Install Rock Dissipation at the end of the concrete trickle channel to minimize further 

undermining and erosion. 

***Load & Haul-Off material staged by others to offsite location*** 

 

Hydromulch disturbed area(s) during the course and scope of construction by BPI. 

This will have two types of seed mixes, (Bermuda & Winter Rye) in addition, Triple 15 

fertilizer to help ignite the growth process of the reveg.



Item & Description Quantity Unit Price Total

Water Quality Pond - Sediment Removal & Maintenance Package B 1 $0.00  $0.00

One-time subtotal $263,332.91

Total $263,332.91

Total contract value $263,332.91

 

Payment terms are NET 30 from the date of the invoice submission.

Inclusions:

BPI Includes one of the option items in Option A or Option B.

Total All Main Entrances: = 2, 580.00

 
Options:
Trees, we can wrap trees with mini lights, just ask!

Wreaths, additional decorations can be added to your wreaths including bells, globes, etc..

Have a decoration idea or would you like to see additional options? No problem! Please ask!
 
Changes/Additions:

We understand that changes/additions occasionally happen.  We will strive to make every effort possible to accommodate any such changes as they occur.  Since materials can be difficult to source as Dec. 25th approaches, we ask that we be given sufficient time, 1 business week or more, to accommodate your changes to your satisfaction. Conversely, any instance in material supply availability or delivery that has the potential to push out installation or completion of this project will be immediately communicated to Natalie Boykin or another appointed contact. 


Service Level Agreement:

Any maintenance issue or service call will be addressed within 8 hours, if not sooner and completed no later than 24hrs from initial notification. I will serve as your main contact for any and all service/maintenance needs. My mobile number will serve as the main contact along with my email for follow-up.

and Regional Operations Personnel and a quick, professional 
Response to all requests.

in the cleaning industry. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 

 
 



FALCON POINTE COMMUINTY ASSOCIATION 

 

 
J a n i - K i n g  o f  A u s t i n  C o m m e r c i a l  C l e a n i n g  S e r v i c e s  

 

 

 

Page 3 

 
 

JANI-KING INTERNATIONAL 
 
 

 Serving the needs of commercial clientele since 1969. 
 

 Original innovator of franchising concept in the janitorial business. 
 

 Over 15,000 Franchisees internationally with regional support centers in twenty countries and 
eighty-one domestic markets. 
 

 Rated number one in the janitorial industry in the last ten of eleven years. 
 

 Rated one of the top ten Franchisers internationally. 
 

 Full time Research and Development, Operations and National Account Development Staffs. 
 

 Providing exemplary services to tens of thousands of Clients world-wide. 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 



FALCON POINTE COMMUINTY ASSOCIATION 

 

 
J a n i - K i n g  o f  A u s t i n  C o m m e r c i a l  C l e a n i n g  S e r v i c e s  

 

 

 

Page 4 

 
THE JANI-KING FRANCHISING CONCEPT 

 
 
 

JANI-KING is a commercial cleaning service, in the business since 1969 that has dramatically changed the 
commercial cleaning and maintenance industry. 
 
JANI-KING recognized years ago that serious problems existed with conventional cleaning services.  These 
problems stemmed from a lack of proper supervision, communication, and little concern about a job well 
done.  At JANI-KING, we realize that quality work is directly related to the individual workers’ training, 
motivation and supervision.  Locating quality individuals who possess the ability to consistently supervise 
and motivate cleaning personnel can solve these problems.

documents.content:
Dear Homeowner, 
  
The annual Voting Representative election for each Neighborhood will be held from 
August 04,2025 - August 21,2025. If you are interested in representing your 
Neighborhood, please complete the attached candidate form and return it to the Falcon 
Pointe office no later than August 1, 2025, at 5 pm. 
  
The form may be returned in person, by mail, or by email to 
manager@falconpointecommunity.com. 
  
For any neighborhood with more than one candidate, a ballot listing each Neighborhood 
Voting Representative candidate will be available online on owners.psprop.net on August 
8, 2025. Votes may be cast by written ballot at the HOA office or by electronic voting 
starting August 14, 2025. Votes will be accepted by 5:00 p.m. on August 21,2025. 
The results of the election will be posted on the website on or before August 28,2025. 
Voting representatives will then be responsible for electing someone to represent the two 
open HOA board positions soon thereafter. 
  
The primary role of a Neighborhood Voting Representative is to cast all votes attributable 
to the Units in their section on all Association matters requiring a membership vote, as 
described in the community By-Laws. A full summary of the Neighborhood Voting 
Representative’s responsibilities is attached to this letter. 
  
We encourage you to represent your neighborhood by submitting your name as a 
candidate. Your participation in this election is essential. PLEASE REMEMBER TO VOTE! 
  
If you have any questions, please contact the Association office at 512-670-1400 or 
manager@falconpointecommunity.com. 
  
On Behalf of the Board of Directors 
  
Karen McConnell, CAM 
  
Falcon Pointe Community Manager

FALCON POINTE REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL

This Request for Proposal (RFP) form is used by the Falcon Pointe HOA Board of Directors and Management to define a scope of work, and uniformly solicit proposals from vendors and service providers.  Please fill out the form below completely.  Any specific scope details, drawings, diagrams, maps, and documents should be attached to this form.  Any RFP exceeding $500.00 requires Board approval.  Please clearly note or outline any time sensitive aspects of the submitted proposal.

Submit documents to: FalconPointeManager@goodwintx.com,

documents.content:
January 8, 2015 

 
 

Natalie Boykin 

Association Manager 

Falcon Pointe Community Association, Inc. 

19015 Falcon Pointe Boulevard 
Pflugerville, TX 78660 
 

RE: Falcon Pointe Homeowners Association Landscape Maintenance 

 
 

Dear Natalie, 
 

ValleyCrest is pleased to submit a professional landscape maintenance proposal for 

Falcon Pointe Homeowners Association. We are very excited by the opportunity to 

continue our partnership with you on the continual improvement of this great community. 

We commit to provide an exceptional level of service and quality.  

 

The enclosed proposal was developed based on your feedback, coupled with our 

evaluation of the property conditions, and will demonstrate how our experienced, skilled 

team will achieve the goal of keeping Falcon Pointe looking its best. Throughout our 

service partnership, you will see a continued focus on the level of customer service, site 

quality and communication. In particular the following are areas that you indicated as high 

priority will receive special attention: 

 

 

 Priority Item #1 Irrigation Management – As your partner, it is our goal to work with 

you towards continual improvement of the irrigation system to ensure efficient and 

effective watering methods. Our team of dedicated irrigation professionals developed a 

watering plan to adequately irrigate all of the community under the guidelines of the 

Stage III water restrictions. While the City of Pflugerville does not grant variances under 

Stage III water restrictions, our watering plan was adapted by the City of Pflugerville 

and a Large Property Variance was granted.  

 

12909 Dessau Road 

Austin, Texas 78754 

tel:  512.989.5724 

fax: 512.990.7997 

 

www.valleycrest.com 

 



 Priority Item #2 Turf Quality Improvement – Turf quality is an important part of 

creating a pristine look at Falcon Pointe. This is becoming increasingly challenging in

Thank you for the opportunity to provide a landscape maintenance proposal for Falcon Pointe HOA.

After reviewing the properties current status and everything that goes in to the community, we

believe we can continue to provide quality landscape service and improve your overall landscape

experience. LandCare takes pride in being a trusted advisor for you and your team.

After speaking with you, Monique, and the Landscape Comittee, we know LandCare will address any

current concerns you have while exceeding expectations. We will do this by: 

• Offer a full credit of the tree trimming proposal over three years (33K value/year) for the 
property upon execution of a three year renewal of the maintenance contract. Tree trimming 
is a great multiple year plan and to combine this with the maintenance contract at no charge 
will bring great value to the property.

• Our irrigation inspections identify the efficiency of your system and allow us to propose 
improvements that will help you lower your operating costs, while protecting plants, site 
operations, and infrastructure. More involved analysis with return on investment calculations is 
also available which will incorporate any available rebates or incentives from your local water 
authority.

• Providing an account manager to the property for proactive communication and immediate 
follow up. Our qualified account managers are dedicated to properties to serve them and 
create a true partnership. This results in less oversight and frustration creating a true trusted 
advisor for the property.

• While communication and responsiveness are one of our highest priorities, we also know that 
quality work is of high importance as well.

2.1.43. Tree branches must be thinned and elevated as needed, in accordance with instruction by the 
contractor’s Arborist. This applies to tree branches/limbs and palm fronds within 15 feet or 
less of the ground. 

2.1.44. All trees within the common areas should be trimmed to 8 feet at minimum to create a clearance 
for the maintenance crew and pedestrian traffic. Trees should remain trimmed away from 
sidewalks or pathways ensuring sidewalks and paths are clear and safe. Trees over the streets 
should be trimmed to 14 feet minimum for emergency vehicles. 

2.1.45. All plant material that is pruned or trimmed off communities’ shrubs and trees will be hauled 
away and disposed of by the Contractor within the scope of maintenance. 

2.1.46. Any tree over 8’ should be trimmed outside the normal scope of maintenance. Contractor will 
provide proposals for tree trimming over 8’ to the Falcon Pointe HOA 

2.1.47. Plant material shall be inspected (and treated if needed) at each service to detect potential 
infestations of insects and/or disease. A preventative spray program is to be implemented by 
the contractor to provide protection against potential infestations. Legally approved 
chemicals are to be used to treat the problem. 

2.1.48. Due care will be taken at all times when applying pesticides and must be performed by or under 
the direct supervision of a licensed applicator. 

2.1.49. Upon award, the contractor will provide a preventative spray program in writing for all lawn, 
weed, shrub, tree, and bed maintenance to be reviewed and approved by the Community

should remain at four inches above the tops of

2.1.70. Spray pattern of each sprinkler head to be maintained for proper water distribution and to 

minimize overflow of water onto sidewalks, driveways, roads and facilities. 
2.1.71. The contractor must maintain seals to prevent weeping of water from the system while 

operating. 
2.1.72. If possible, The sprinkler system shall be checked immediately after each mowing for any 

damages, which shall be repaired by the contractor at the contractor’s expense. Repairs should 
be made with parts that are the same or equal to original parts. 

2.1.73. The system shall be fully evaluated at the time the contractor begins work on the property. This 
evaluation, along with cost estimates to bring the system to acceptable working conditions, 
shall be given in writing to Falcon Pointe HOA. The cost of this initial evaluation shall be the 
responsibility of the contractor. Any necessary repairs shall be at the expense of the Falcon 
Pointe HOA if approved.

boundaries such as fences, walls, etc. This shall be accomplished based upon local code 
enforcement guidelines and/or ordinances and uniformity of appearance. 

2.1.76. Where applicable, the contractor should include the cost of trimming any fenced or wall areas 
in the basic services annual rate. Frequency shall be determined by the Community Association 
Manager and shall, at a minimum, meet local code enforcement guidelines and/or ordinances. 

2.1.77. Contractor shall reference community maps depicting landscaping zones/areas of 
responsibility.

documents.content:
1) Services.  The Contractor agrees to perform the landscape management services noted on the
"Landscape Management Annual Schedule" in accordance with the “Specifications” both of which are 
attached to and incorporated into this Agreement, for the property of the Owner, located at Falcon 
Pointe Community Association Inc., 19015 Falcon Pointe Blvd, Pflugerville, TX 78660, (hereinafter 
referred to as the "Property").

2) Start Date.  This Agreement shall commence on October 01, 2020, and shall renew for two (2) additional 
year's at the same price. Price adjustments (paragraph 3.C. below) on the anniversary date of the 
Agreement (end of third year) unless terminated by either party by providing thirty (30) days written 
notice prior to the end of the then current term.

3) Consideration/Payment/Price Adjustments.

A. In consideration for the Contractor's performance for services described in the “Landscape 
Management Annual Schedule”, Owner agrees to pay Contractor an annual sum of $342,001.28 
invoiced in accordance with the attached "Payment Schedule."

B. Invoices will be sent on or about the 1st day of each month for current month's services and 
payment shall be due upon receipt. A late charge of 1.5% per month shall be charged on all 
amounts 30 days past due and a $20.00 fee will apply to any returned check.

C. Approximately sixty (60) days prior to the end of the third year, Contractor may send Owner 
notification of renewal and a price adjustment.  If the Owner does not object in writing within 30 
days of the date of the notification of price adjustment, then the renewal of this Agreement shall 
include the price adjustment.  If the Owner objects to the notification of price adjustment in 
writing within 30 days of the date of notice then Contractor has the option to either (i) renew the 
Agreement without the price adjustment or (ii) terminate the Agreement.

4) Additional Services.

PHILADELPHIA INSURANCE COMPANIES 
 

DISCLOSURE NOTICE OF TERRORISM INSURANCE COVERAGE REJECTION OPTION 

You are hereby notified that under the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act, as amended, you have a right to purchase insurance 

coverage for losses resulting from acts of terrorism. As defined in Section 102(1) of the Act: The term “act of terrorism” means 

any act or acts that are certified by the Secretary of the Treasury—in consultation with the Secretary of Homeland Security, and 

the Attorney General of the United States—to be an act of terrorism; to be a violent act or an act that is dangerous to human 

life, property, or infrastructure; to have resulted in damage within the United States, or outside the United States in the case of 

certain air carriers or vessels or the premises of a United States mission; and to have been committed by an individual or 

individuals as part of an effort to coerce the civilian population of the United States or to influence the policy or affect the conduct 

of the United States Government by coercion. 

YOU SHOULD KNOW THAT WHERE COVERAGE IS PROVIDED BY THIS POLICY FOR LOSSES RESULTING FROM

documents.content:
CHANDLER CREEK HOA POOL RULES 
Rules/Hours are subject to change 

 
HOURS: 

Regular Season: April 1 to October 31: 7am to 9pm  
Off-season: November 1 to March 31: 7am to 7pm 

 
ONLY RESIDENTS THAT HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL AND 
TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 
 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not explicitly 
covered by these and other rules. They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings should be taken to 
the Association management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitors. Pool Monitors are authorized to 
enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 
 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these following pool rules will be reported to the Chandler 
Creek Homeowners Association and possibly the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board’s discretion. 
 
1. The Chandler Creek swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OUR RISK pool.  No lifeguards will be on duty.  Children under age 16 

must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule will be strictly enforced. 
 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion.  Please use caution. 
 

3. All residents are required to show their pool pass and a valid State of Texas ID if requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply 
may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 
 

4. The access gates can only be opened with a pool access card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will
documents.path: /drives/b!nslWL7oJf0GurAFazjx4oOabfa0q4iZMh47wxSLJiqST3qiwOUFDQ6RKwkvmcuX4/root:/Chandler Creek HOA/Operations/Pool/Chandler Creek Pool Rules.pdf
documents.title: Chandler Creek Pool Rules.pdf

documents.content:
card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will 
be asked to retrieve theirs before they will be allowed to enter the pool area.  Under no circumstances should the gate be 
propped open.  There is a $20.00 fee for lost pool access cards/fobs. 
 

5. Each pool guest must be accompanied by a resident who remains at the pool during the guest’s visit. One household may host 
up to three (3) guests. 
 

6. Chandler Creek homeowners have the authority to enforce the current pool rules at all times.  Conduct by any person deemed 
to be dangerous, unreasonable or offensive (including “horseplay”) is not allowed and should be reported to the Pool Monitor.  
Any individual disciplined repeatedly, or for serious infractions, may lose all pool privileges for the rest of the season.  
 

7. The kiddy pool is limited to children 5 years of age and younger. Exceptions may be made for older children with injuries which 
would prevent them from safely entering the main pool.  Each child in the kiddy pool must have an adult supervisor; however, 
one (1) adult may supervise multiple children. 
 

8. NO DIVING ALLOWED.  Absolutely no running, dunking or rough play at any time.  There will be no throwing of or pushing 
people into the pool.  Anyone exhibiting this type of behavior will be asked to leave the area. 
 

9. Under no circumstances shall pets, bicycles, skateboards, scooters or motorized cycles be permitted within the pool fences.  
Roller-skates and/or rollerblades may be carried into the pool area and stored with personal belongings but may not be worn 
within the pool fences.  The throwing of objects (balls, Frisbees®, etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.

POOL ACCESS AGREEMENT

This pool access agreement (herein the “Agreement”) is entered into between Chandler Creek HOA (the “Association”) and the owner, or person 
authorized to engage in this agreement on owner’s behalf, including owners tenant, guests, or invitees (collectively referred to herein as “Grantee”) 
of property identified herein, whether such owner is a person, corporation, partnership, or other legal entity being granted access to an Association 
facility and/or purchasing an access device for use in relation to an Association facility.  The Association and Grantee are sometimes collectively 
referred to herein as the “Parties”. 

EFFECTIVE DATE: This agreement is to be effective as of the date shown below. 

CONSIDERATION AND RECEIPT: This agreement is entered into for the consideration of the representations, warranties, covenants, and agreements 
contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, including access to facilities that may be conditional by Association rule on the 
receipt of the signed agreement, payment of assessment, and payment for and/or receipt and programming of access device(s), the receipt and 
sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged. 

AUTHORITY: The undersigned signatories to this Agreement hereby represent and warrant that they are legally authorized to sign this Agreement 
and other contracts on behalf of the Parties.

documents.content:
tobacco, vapor cigarettes, etc.).  Under no circumstances will 
alcohol, firearms or drugs be permitted in the pool area or surrounding park and anyone seen engaging in the use of such will be 
subject to loss of privileges for a period of time to be determined by the Association Board and other legal actions may be taken 
in conjunction with the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office. 
 

19. Swim safely and treat others as you would like to be treated.  Parents are responsible for the behavior of their children and/or 
their guests. 
 

20. In the event of inclement weather, swimmers are to clear the pool during the storm and for at least thirty (30) minutes after  
lightning and/or thunder has ceased.   
 

21. Any resident may call the current HOA management company to report unsafe behavior or violations of pool rules they witness.  
In case of an emergency, call 911.  An emergency call box is located right outside of the pool gates in the courtyard. 

 
22. Access to the multi-purpose room is by advance reservation only. 
 
Miscellaneous: 
 

Restrooms: The restroom fixtures are sanitized and cleaned by a private janitorial service.  The designated maintenance 
person/company is responsible for cleaning mirrors, counters, stocking hand towels, soap, emptying trash and cleaning the floors 
and toilets.  Please be mindful of the other Association members by cleaning up after yourself when using the restrooms.  If the 
restrooms should require attention, please notify the pool monitor on duty or call the current HOA management company. 
 
Penalties for Violation of Pool Rules: 
 

Depending upon severity of offense, action taken by the HOA for violation of HOA Pool Rules may include one or more of the 
following: 
 

 1st offense – A written warning will be issued (Notification of parents or guardian, when applicable). 

 2nd offense – A second written warning will be issued

POOL ACCESS AGREEMENT

This pool access agreement (herein the “Agreement”) is entered into between Chandler Creek HOA (the “Association”) and the owner, or person 
authorized to engage in this agreement on owner’s behalf, including owners tenant, guests, or invitees (collectively referred to herein as “Grantee”) 
of property identified herein, whether such owner is a person, corporation, partnership, or other legal entity being granted access to an Association 
facility and/or purchasing an access device for use in relation to an Association facility.  The Association and Grantee are sometimes collectively 
referred to herein as the “Parties”. 

EFFECTIVE DATE: This agreement is to be effective as of the date shown below. 

CONSIDERATION AND RECEIPT: This agreement is entered into for the consideration of the representations, warranties, covenants, and agreements 
contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, including access to facilities that may be conditional by Association rule on the 
receipt of the signed agreement, payment of assessment, and payment for and/or receipt and programming of access device(s), the receipt and 
sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged. 

AUTHORITY: The undersigned signatories to this Agreement hereby represent and warrant that they are legally authorized to sign this Agreement 
and other contracts on behalf of the Parties.

documents.content:
etc.) will not be allowed. 
 

10. No offensive language. 
 

11. No food or drinks allowed in the pool.  Food and drinks are allowed in designated areas only or at least 6 feet away from the 
pool.  No alcoholic beverages or glass containers allowed 
 

12. All coolers, ice-chests, and bags will be subject to search in order to adhere to the “no alcohol” rule. 
 

13. No littering.  All trash generated by swimmers must be placed in garbage containers or otherwise properly disposed of. 
 

14. No flotation devices allowed (EXCEPTIONS: arm floaties and toddler life preservers). 
 



   

15. Proper swim attire must be worn at all times (infants and toddlers included).  No cut-offs, thongs or street clothes will be 
allowed in the pool. 
 

16. Children who are not toilet-trained are not allowed in the main pool or the kiddy pool without a “swim” diaper and must be 
accompanied by an adult within arm’s length at all times.  Children wearing regular diapers will not be allowed in either the 
main pool or the kiddy pool.  “Swim” diapers must be used at all times.  If your child or anyone else in your party is found to be 
responsible for a closure due to fecal matter, all costs to clean and reopen the pool may be assigned to your family.  If a fecal 
accident occurs: All swimmers must exit the pool immediately and the pool will be closed for the minimum time frame as 
allowed by law from the time the pool has been chemically treated.  Incidents should be immediately reported to the current 
HOA management company. 
 

17. Persons having currently active diarrhea or who have had active diarrhea within the previous 14 days shall not be allowed to 
enter the pool water.   
 

18. No smoking or any other use of tobacco products (Skoal®, chewing tobacco, vapor cigarettes, etc.).  Under no circumstances will 
alcohol, firearms or drugs be permitted in the pool area or surrounding park and anyone seen engaging in the use of such will be

CHANDLER CREEK HOA POOL RULES 
Rules/Hours are subject to change 

 
HOURS: 

Regular Season: April 1 to October 31: 7am to 9pm  
Off-season: November 1 to March 31: 7am to 7pm 

 
ONLY RESIDENTS THAT HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL AND 
TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 
 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not explicitly 
covered by these and other rules. They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings should be taken to 
the Association management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitors. Pool Monitors are authorized to 
enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 
 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these following pool rules will be reported to the Chandler 
Creek Homeowners Association and possibly the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board’s discretion. 
 
1. The Chandler Creek swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OUR RISK pool.  No lifeguards will be on duty.  Children under age 16 

must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule will be strictly enforced. 
 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion.  Please use caution. 
 

3. All residents are required to show their pool pass and a valid State of Texas ID if requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply 
may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 
 

4. The access gates can only be opened with a pool access card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will
documents.path: /drives/b!nslWL7oJf0GurAFazjx4oOabfa0q4iZMh47wxSLJiqST3qiwOUFDQ6RKwkvmcuX4/root:/Chandler Creek HOA/Public/Community Info/Pool Rules.pdf

documents.content:
tobacco, vapor cigarettes, etc.).  Under no circumstances will 
alcohol, firearms or drugs be permitted in the pool area or surrounding park and anyone seen engaging in the use of such will be 
subject to loss of privileges for a period of time to be determined by the Association Board and other legal actions may be taken 
in conjunction with the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office. 
 

19. Swim safely and treat others as you would like to be treated.  Parents are responsible for the behavior of their children and/or 
their guests. 
 

20. In the event of inclement weather, swimmers are to clear the pool during the storm and for at least thirty (30) minutes after  
lightning and/or thunder has ceased.   
 

21. Any resident may call the current HOA management company to report unsafe behavior or violations of pool rules they witness.  
In case of an emergency, call 911.  An emergency call box is located right outside of the pool gates in the courtyard. 

 
22. Access to the multi-purpose room is by advance reservation only. 
 
Miscellaneous: 
 

Restrooms: The restroom fixtures are sanitized and cleaned by a private janitorial service.  The designated maintenance 
person/company is responsible for cleaning mirrors, counters, stocking hand towels, soap, emptying trash and cleaning the floors 
and toilets.  Please be mindful of the other Association members by cleaning up after yourself when using the restrooms.  If the 
restrooms should require attention, please notify the pool monitor on duty or call the current HOA management company. 
 
Penalties for Violation of Pool Rules: 
 

Depending upon severity of offense, action taken by the HOA for violation of HOA Pool Rules may include one or more of the 
following: 
 

 1st offense – A written warning will be issued (Notification of parents or guardian, when applicable). 

 2nd offense – A second written warning will be issued

after lightning and/or thunder has ceased. 

21. Any resident may call the current HOA management company to report unsafe behavior or violations of pool rules they 
witness.  In case of an emergency, call 911.  An emergency call box is located right outside of the front pool gate in the 
courtyard. 

22. Access to the multi-purpose room is by advance reservation only. 

Miscellaneous: 

Restrooms:  The restroom fixtures are sanitized and cleaned by a private janitorial service.  The designated maintenance 
person/company is responsible for cleaning mirrors, counters, stocking hand towels, soap, emptying trashed and cleaning 
the floors and toilets.  Please be mindful of other HOA members by cleaning up after yourself when using the restrooms.  If 
the restroom should require attention, please notify the Pool Monitor on duty or call the current HOA management 
company. 

Penalties for Violation of Pool Rules: 

Depending on upon severity of offense, action taken by the HOA for violation of HOA pool rues may include one or more of 
the following: 

• 1st offense – A written warning is issued (notification of registered homeowner, parent, or guardian, when 
applicable) 

• 2nd offense – A second written warning is issued. 

• 3rd offense – Pool privileges are revoked, and pool card deactivated. 

• Criminal and civil complaints are filed when applicable: 
1. Notification of Sheriff’s Office 
2. Prosecution and/or other legal remedies

Agenda Item 10 – Such other Matters as may come before the Board/Executive Committee. 
 

1. Executive Committee vacancies – An item was included in the HOA newsletter 
announcing the vacant positions. 

2. Annual Easter Egg Hunt – Director Barnes is organizing this event. The event will be 
held April 5, 2025, from 10 a.m. to 11 a.m. and will include an Annual Easter Egg hunt 
with a post-hunt gathering at the HOA Party Room with hot chocolate and treats. The 
Williamson County ESD #9 will hold a Fire Safety Event after the Easter Egg Hunt and 
will have a fire engine present and plan to hand out fire blankets. Information about the 
Easter Egg Hunt will be included in the March newsletter. 

3. Summer Pool Party – Director Barnes is organizing this event. All  vendors have been 
scheduled for the June 7, 2025, event which will be held from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. There 
will be food, popsicles, and music at the pool party. 

4. Williamson County Emergency Services District (ESD 9) fire blanket project – The fire 
blankets will be handed out at 11 a.m., April 5, 2025, after the Annual Easter Egg Hunt. 

5. The City of Round Rock’s annual bulk trash pickup was discussed. Homeowners can 
now call Republic Services to schedule their bulk trash pickup date. An item regarding 
the bulk trash pickup will be included in the next HOA newsletter. 

6. Proposed Chandler Creek Homeowners’ Association Deed Restriction Enforcement 
Process discussed and reviewed. The proposed enforcement process document will be 
further reviewed, and a second draft will be presented to the Board of Directors for 
discussion and approval. The draft enforcement process document will need to be 
reviewed by the HOA’s General Counsel.  
 
 



5

None.

third or fourth week of October.

IRRIGATION SERVICE AND MAINTENANCE 

1) This agreement only covers the communal area irrigation system. The Customer is 

responsible for providing the water to the system.    



Chandler Creek HOA Landscape Management Agreement 8/31/22 

   9  

2) Irrigation will be monitored during regular maintenance visits.  If issues arise, licensed 

irrigation crew will be dispatched to perform corrective measures.      

3) Minor head adjustments, cleaning of nozzles, and heads, spray patterns adjusted to 

improve water coverage, arc, and radius adjustments as necessary on all rotor zones and 

included in service during regular inspections. All other repairs will be billed 

accordingly.  

4) The irrigation systems will have a monthly inspection and will be adjusted accordingly 

to insure proper moisture levels, as possible, for landscaped plant material.  Timelines 

for irrigation inspections may vary as Company may combine inspection with an 

irrigation service visit, when possible, to minimize additional costs to the HOA.    

5) Repairs and operation of these systems shall comply with TCEQ, City/MUD and/or 

applicable authorized government entity rules and regulations.  

6) If prior approval is required by Customer for irrigation repairs, the system may be shut 

down upon completion of the inspection and/or if an issue arises between monthly 

inspections and if it is determined by the Company that operation of the system will 

violate any governmental rules and/or regulations, to include runoff, over spray, broken 

lines, etc. Company shall not be responsible for any issues arising from irrigation system 

being turned off, to include damage to the landscape.    

7) Local watering restrictions may affect specific watering times and usage.    

8) Irrigation systems will be adjusted as part of this agreement with scheduled visit to keep

Other Matter

The Homeowners' Association For Chandler Creek, Inc. has not estimated the remaining useful lives and 
replacement costs of common property and, therefore, management has omitted Supplementary 
Information on Future Major Repairs and Replacements that accounting principles generally accepted in 
the United States of America require to be presented to supplement the basic financial statements.  Such 
missing information, although not a part of the basic financial statements, is required by the Financial 
Accounting Standards Board, who considers it to be an essential part of financial reporting for placing 
the basic financial statements in an appropriate operational, economic, or historical context.  Our opinion 
on the basic financial statements is not affected by the missing information.

August 31, 2022 

Chandler Creek HOA (“Customer”) 

2323 Agarita Trail, Round Rock, TX 78665 

LANDSCAPE MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT 

 

GENERAL ITEMS 

1) Ecosystems Landscape Services (Company) proposes to provide all materials, labor, 

supervision, and all necessary insurance to perform the services as listed below.  Entire 

property will be maintained as one site, meaning same general maintenance performed 

on all areas. 

2) The purpose of this landscape management plan is to ensure that Company provides first 

class service to our customer. 

3) Property will have always a neat, clean, healthy, and manicured appearance after visits. 

4) Property will have an assigned Account Manager to assure that all services provided 

follow this agreement. Company shall remain vigilant and constantly be on the look-out 

for damage to the landscape and shall notify Customer as soon as possible for Customer 

to take corrective action. 

5) Property shall be maintained utilizing appropriate technology, equipment, and industry 

accepted techniques such that all turf and landscape ground covers, shrubs, and trees 

remain vigorous, healthy, and visually acceptable. 

6) Crew members shall be properly trained and supervised and in proper uniform always. 

7) Any dumped and/or piled debris, large limbs, and/or fallen trees to be removed and billed 

on Time and Materials basis upon approval from Customer and/or Management 

Company. 

8) No on-site dumpsters will be utilized, or on-site disposal will be performed, unless 

specifically addressed in this agreement.   

9) Porter Services are not included in this agreement. 



Chandler Creek HOA Landscape Management Agreement 8/31/22 

   2  

10) Clean up of all landscape debris generated during regular maintenance visits, to include 

leaves, small limbs, twigs, etc., to be cleaned up as part of regular service in areas as

To the Board of Directors and Members
The Homeowners' Association For Chandler Creek, Inc.

We have audited the accompanying financial statements of The Homeowners' Association For Chandler 
Creek, Inc., which comprise the balance sheet as of December 31, 2013, and the related statement of 
revenues, expenses, and changes in members’ equity, and cash flow for the year then ended, and the 
related notes to the financial statements.

Management’s Responsibility for the Financial Statements

Management is responsible for the preparation and fair presentation of these financial statements in 
accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America; this includes 
the design, implementation, and maintenance of internal control relevant to the preparation and fair 
presentation of financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or 
error.

Auditor’s Responsibility

Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audit. We

SERVICE MAP 

 

EXPLANATION OF SCHEDULE 

1) Schedule is a basic guideline for services and subject to change based upon best 

agronomic practices.  Any major changes will be addressed with Customer ahead of time. 

2) Application date for fertilizer, mulch installation, weed control, fungicide, etc. are 

subject to change based on weather conditions, leaf drop, etc. and agronomic needs and 

do not affect the scope of work for this agreement. 

3) Areas with forty-two (42) visits means all services to performed weekly as needed during 

the growing season, which is roughly the first or second week of March thru about the 

third or fourth week of October.   



Chandler Creek HOA Landscape Management Agreement 8/31/22 

   4  

4) Areas listed as monthly will be most likely be done the same week each month, weather 

permitting.   

5) The “off-season” is considered November- February.   Off season visits will consist only 

with mowing only as needed and includes detail work of beds, trees, trash clean up, etc.    

6) Exact visits per month may vary based on fluctuating weeks in any given month per year.   

Weekly services in off season are only twice monthly for all areas; therefore, specific

➢ Installation of “Native Grind” mulch available and priced according to scope of work.

➢ Aeration & topdressing of all irrigated turf areas, and at an approximate recommended

and the depth is an average. Some areas may need more and some less depending on turf 

type, density, etc. This service is best to be performed in March/April. Topdressing 

service is not designed to level all areas.

2014 Annual Meeting

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that the undersigned Homeowner in The Homeowners' 

Association for Chandler Creek, Inc. does hereby constitute, authorize, and appoint: (please check one of 

the options below) 

 

     Option #1 ____________________________________ (name) (someone who will attend the meeting 

on your behalf) 

 

By this designation of proxy, the Proxy may attend and represent the Homeowner with the full power to 

vote and act for the Homeowner in the same manner, to the extent and with the same effect as if the 

Homeowner were personally present. 

 

     Option #2 A Director of the Board who is not running for re-election for both voting and quorum 

purposes as the Proxy for the Homeowner to act on behalf of Homeowner at the Annual Meeting of 

members of The Homeowners' Association for Chandler Creek, Inc., and at any adjournment of the 

Annual Meeting or any subsequent meeting called to conduct or complete the Annual Meeting. 

 

The Proxy shall have full power to represent the Homeowner and vote on all issues and motions that are 

properly presented at the meeting(s) for which this designation of proxy is effective. The Proxy shall have 

the authority to vote entirely at the discretion of the Proxy. 

 

     Option #3 This proxy is to be used for quorum purposes only. The proxy will be held by a 

Director not running but will not be used for their voting privileges.   
     

Unless sooner terminated, this voting instrument shall terminate automatically upon the final adjournment 

of the Annual Meeting for which it is given. 

 

 

EXECUTED this____________ day of _____________________, 2014

CHANDLER CREEK HOA POOL RULES 
Rules/Hours are subject to change 

 
HOURS: 

Regular Season: April 1 to October 31: 7am to 9pm  
Off-season: November 1 to March 31: 7am to 7pm 

 
ONLY RESIDENTS THAT HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL AND 
TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 
 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not explicitly 
covered by these and other rules. They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings should be taken to 
the Association management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitors. Pool Monitors are authorized to 
enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 
 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these following pool rules will be reported to the Chandler 
Creek Homeowners Association and possibly the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board’s discretion. 
 
1. The Chandler Creek swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OUR RISK pool.  No lifeguards will be on duty.  Children under age 16 

must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule will be strictly enforced. 
 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion.  Please use caution. 
 

3. All residents are required to show their pool pass and a valid State of Texas ID if requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply 
may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 
 

4. The access gates can only be opened with a pool access card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will

On Thu, Apr 17, 2025 at 11:27 AM Chris Davis <daviscm75@gmail.com> wrote:
I am disputing the validity of the "violation". The codes you have sighted are vague and
subjective. "Miscellaneous" or "unsightly" items cannot be defined by one person. What
one person finds "unsightly" or even "miscellaneous" can be seen by others as beautiful
or useful. There are many items in people's yard and driveways throughout all of
Chandler Creek that I would never dream of putting on display or even letting be in my
yard. I would never dream of complaining about them just because I don't like it. And
I'm definitely not giving you specific addresses for you to investigate. It makes me
wonder if the best course of action would be just to ignore communication of this kind?
I can't imagine the justification of kitchen equipment, tarp covered vehicles,
collapsible/foldable chairs, old holiday decorations, broken lawn decorations and other
"miscellaneous" and "unsightly" items to be allowed to stay in plain sight for as long as

In accordance with industry standards, real property and common areas donated by the developer 
are not capitalized on the Association’s financial statements.  Personal property purchased with 
Association funds, to which the Association holds title, will be capitalized at cost and depreciated over 
their estimated useful lives using the straight-line method of depreciation.  Common property consists of,
but is not limited to parks, recreational facilities, community streets, walkways, and parking lots.



7

THE HOMEOWNERS' ASSOCIATION FOR CHANDLER CREEK, INC.
NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONT.)

DECEMBER 31, 2013

NOTE 2 -- SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (CONT.)

D. FISCAL YEAR

The Association has a fiscal year beginning on January 1 and ending on December 31.

E. CASH AND CASH EQUIVALENTS

Cash and cash equivalents for the statement of cash flows include amounts in checking accounts.

F. ESTIMATES

The preparation of financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting 
principles requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of 
assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial 
statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.  Actual 
results could differ from those estimates.

G. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS

Subsequent events were evaluated through September 25, 2014, which is the date the financial 
statements were available to be issued.

NOTE 3 -- FUTURE MAJOR REPAIRS AND REPLACEMENTS

Although not specifically required in by-laws, industry practice is to establish reserves over a 
number of years to fund major repairs and replacement of Common Area components.  Accumulated 
funds for major repairs and replacements should be accounted for in separate certificates of deposit and 
savings accounts and generally are not available for expenditures for normal operations.

CHANDLER CREEK HOA POOL RULES 
Rules/Hours are subject to change 

 
HOURS: 

Regular Season: April 1 to October 31: 7am to 9pm  
Off-season: November 1 to March 31: 7am to 7pm 

 
ONLY RESIDENTS THAT HAVE PAID ALL HOMEOWNER ASSOCIATION ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PERMITTED TO USE THE POOL AND 
TENNIS COURT FACILITIES. 
 

Pool Monitors represent the HOA Board of Directors and have authority to make discretionary rulings on behavior not explicitly 
covered by these and other rules. They are not lifeguards and will not act as such.  Complaints about their rulings should be taken to 
the Association management after first complying with the decision(s) made by the Pool Monitors. Pool Monitors are authorized to 
enforce the following rules including the ejection of non-compliant residents and/or guests. 
 

Any individual(s) reported to be/or found to be in violation of any of these following pool rules will be reported to the Chandler 
Creek Homeowners Association and possibly the Williamson County Sheriff’s Office (as applicable).  The nature of the situation will 
be considered and action(s) toward resolution will be at the Board’s discretion. 
 
1. The Chandler Creek swimming pool is a SWIM AT YOUR OUR RISK pool.  No lifeguards will be on duty.  Children under age 16 

must be accompanied by a Chandler Creek resident 18 years of age or older.  This rule will be strictly enforced. 
 

2. Use of any facility and/or equipment in the pool area is at your discretion.  Please use caution. 
 

3. All residents are required to show their pool pass and a valid State of Texas ID if requested by a Pool Monitor.  Failure to comply 
may result in you being asked to leave the pool area. 
 

4. The access gates can only be opened with a pool access card/fob.  Gates are to remain locked at all times.  The Pool Monitors 
have been instructed not to open the gate for anyone without a pool access card/fob.  Anyone without an access card/fob will

On Thu, Apr 17, 2025 at 11:27 AM Chris Davis <daviscm75@gmail.com> wrote:
I am disputing the validity of the "violation". The codes you have sighted are vague and
subjective. "Miscellaneous" or "unsightly" items cannot be defined by one person. What
one person finds "unsightly" or even "miscellaneous" can be seen by others as beautiful
or useful. There are many items in people's yard and driveways throughout all of
Chandler Creek that I would never dream of putting on display or even letting be in my
yard. I would never dream of complaining about them just because I don't like it. And
I'm definitely not giving you specific addresses for you to investigate. It makes me
wonder if the best course of action would be just to ignore communication of this kind?
I can't imagine the justification of kitchen equipment, tarp covered vehicles,
collapsible/foldable chairs, old holiday decorations, broken lawn decorations and other
"miscellaneous" and "unsightly" items to be allowed to stay in plain sight for as long as

2014 Annual Meeting 

Proxy 

 
KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that the undersigned Homeowner in The Homeowners' 

Association for Chandler Creek, Inc. does hereby constitute, authorize, and appoint: (please check one of 

the options below) 

 

     Option #1 ____________________________________ (name) (someone who will attend the meeting 

on your behalf) 

 

By this designation of proxy, the Proxy may attend and represent the Homeowner with the full power to 

vote and act for the Homeowner in the same manner, to the extent and with the same effect as if the 

Homeowner were personally present. 

 

     Option #2 A Director of the Board who is not running for re-election for both voting and quorum 

purposes as the Proxy for the Homeowner to act on behalf of Homeowner at the Annual Meeting of 

members of The Homeowners' Association for Chandler Creek, Inc., and at any adjournment of the 

Annual Meeting or any subsequent meeting called to conduct or complete the Annual Meeting. 

 

The Proxy shall have full power to represent the Homeowner and vote on all issues and motions that are 

properly presented at the meeting(s) for which this designation of proxy is effective. The Proxy shall have 

the authority to vote entirely at the discretion of the Proxy. 

 

     Option #3 This proxy is to be used for quorum purposes only. The proxy will be held by a 

Director not running but will not be used for their voting privileges.   
     

Unless sooner terminated, this voting instrument shall terminate automatically upon the final adjournment 

of the Annual Meeting for which it is given. 

 

 

EXECUTED this____________ day of _____________________, 2014

documents.content:
Code, or other law. 
 

4. Open Meeting.  The Board considered this Resolution during a duly noticed 
meeting that was open to the public, in compliance with Chapter 551, Texas 
Government Code.  
 

5. Effective Date.  This Resolution is effective as of the date indicated immediately 
below.  
 

PASSED AND APPROVED this 17th day of January, 2023. 
      
 

     /s/ Walter Berry      
     President, Board of Directors 
     The Meadows at Chandler Creek Municipal Utility District 
 
ATTEST: 
 
/s/ Adrian Bustillos      
Secretary, Board of Directors 
The Meadows at Chandler Creek Municipal Utility District 
  



3 
 

EXHIBIT A 
 

1. The Meadows at Chandler Creek Municipal Utility District Homeowners’ Association 
Board (the “HOA”) reviews Deed Restriction violations and by vote determines which 
should be elevated to The Meadows at Chandler Creek Municipal Utility District (the 
“District”). 

 
2. The District Board reviews the forwarded Deed Restrictions and by vote determines 

whether the District should proceed in accordance with the Violation of District Rules 
Order adopted on July 16, 2019. 
 

3. If the District Board votes to move forward with enforcement the Board will review the 
deed restriction violations and vote on the appropriate fine in accordance with the fine 
schedule in the Deed Restriction Enforcement Resolution adopted on December 15, 2020.  
 

4. After District Board approval to move forward with enforcement, the District will afford 
residents a two-week grace period as an opportunity to cure a violation before a first offense 
violation will be issued. This grace-period does not extend beyond a first offense. This 
grace period is offered at the discretion of the District Board. 
 

5. Fine Schedule (pursuant to the Deed Restriction Enforcement Resolution):   
 

Landscaping Violations: 
• First offense: up to $100 
• Second or additional violation of same offense: up to $200 (or [d]ouble the fine 

for the first offense)
